message.content: {"score": 7, "mistakes": "The summary missed important details such as the specific statements from the Chinese commerce ministry spokesperson and the broader context of tariff conflicts. It also lacks clarity and completeness.", "advice": "Try to include key quotes or paraphrased statements from the article to support the main idea. Additionally, provide a clearer overview of the article's major points.", "correction": "A more complete summary would include specific details from the article, such as the spokesperson's comments on reciprocity and the mention of tariffs.", "model_answer": "China has warned it will counter countries that form deals with the US detrimental to Beijing's interests. A Chinese commerce ministry spokesperson stated that China opposes any agreements harming its interests and will take reciprocal measures if necessary. The warning comes amid ongoing tariff disputes, with duties on Chinese goods reaching 145 percent and retaliatory tariffs on US products at 125 percent. The spokesperson emphasized that China will not accept appeasement and will stand firm against trade deals undermining its economic interests."}
